required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Does Pulmonary Rehabilitation Improve Frailty in Chronic Lung Disease?

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: Frailty is a state of health with predisposition to adverse events, morbidity and mortality. Frailty consists of weakness, slowness, low physical activity, exhaustion, and wasting. Frailty is associated with increased hospitalizations and death in lung disease. It is unknown if pulmonary rehabilitation will improve frailty markers.

detailed_description.textblock: Individuals referred to pulmonary rehabilitation will be examined for frailty markers. After completing pulmonary rehabilitation, the same tests will be performed. The effects of pulmonary rehabilitation will be examined.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Frailty Phenotype at Baseline and 6 Months
primary_outcome.description: Frailty phenotype is 3 or more of: slow gait speed, exhaustion, decreased hand grip strength, decreased activity level, or wasting. Grip strength parameters, gait speed, exhaustion per Fried et al. 2001. Wasting is defined as further decrease in fat free mass by body composition measurement using DEXA. Low physical activity would be activity monitor in lower quartile.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: after pulmonary rehabilation completion, appoximately 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: DXA measurement of body mass index pre- and post- PR.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: after completion of pulmonary rehab, approximately 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Grip Strength as measured by hand dynamometer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre and post pulmonary rehab, approximately 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: gait speed test measured over 15 feet

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre and post pulmonary rehab, approximately 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported exhaustion - measured by two questions in the Center for the Epidemiological Studies in Depression (CES-D) scale and reported as a dichotomous variable (exhausted or not exhausted).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre and post pulmonary rehab, approximately 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by Body Media armband activity monitor using total energy expenditure divided by the resting metabolic rate

arm_group.description: One arm study - all participants will go to pulmonary rehabilitation, received questionnaires, Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA) scans, Dynamometer and gait speed tests and activity measured through an activity monitor.

intervention.description: Measures of frailty taken before and after pulmonary rehabilitation.
Health-related questionnaires measuring self-reported exhaustion, emotions and disease symptoms.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Referred for pulmonary rehabilitation
- consenting to research
Exclusion criteria:
-Under 18 years of age

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Pulmonary Rehabilitation
group.description: One arm study - all participants will go to pulmonary rehabilitation, received questionnaires, DEXA scans, Dynamometer and gait speed tests and activity measured through an activity monitor. Pulmonary Rehabilitation: Measures of frailty taken before and after pulmonary rehabilitation. Dynamometer: Grip Test DEXA: Body Composition Testing Gait Speed Test: 15 foot walk test Activity Monitor: Measures energy expenditure and activity Questionnaires: Health-related questionnaires measuring self-reported exhaustion, emotions and disease symptoms.

group.title: Pulmonary Rehabilitation
group.description: One arm study - all participants will go to pulmonary rehabilitation, received questionnaires, DEXA scans, Dynamometer and gait speed tests and activity measured through an activity monitor. Pulmonary Rehabilitation: Measures of frailty taken before and after pulmonary rehabilitation. Dynamometer: Grip Test DEXA: Body Composition Testing Gait Speed Test: 15 foot walk test Activity Monitor: Measures energy expenditure and activity Questionnaires: Health-related questionnaires measuring self-reported exhaustion, emotions and disease symptoms.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Pulmonary Function - Forced expiratory volume
measure.description: The forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) measurement shows the amount of air in liters a person can forcefully exhale in one second.

measure.title: Pulmonary Function - % Predicted
measure.description: The % predicted represents the percent of the lung size that can be exhaled in one second.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Frailty Phenotype at Baseline and 6 Months
outcome.description: Frailty phenotype is 3 or more of: slow gait speed, exhaustion, decreased hand grip strength, decreased activity level, or wasting. Grip strength parameters, gait speed, exhaustion per Fried et al. 2001. Wasting is defined as further decrease in fat free mass by body composition measurement using DEXA. Low physical activity would be activity monitor in lower quartile.
outcome.population: Forty-nine participants (77.8%) of the 63 participants completed at lease one follow-up frailty parameter assessment after completion of pulmonary rehabilitation.

measure.title: Change in Gait Speed
measure.description: gait speed test measured over 15 feet

outcome.title: Improvement in Exhaustion
outcome.description: Self-reported exhaustion - measured by two questions in the Center for the Epidemiological Studies in Depression (CES-D) scale and reported as a dichotomous variable (exhausted or not exhausted).
outcome.time_frame: pre and post pulmonary rehab, approximately 8 weeks
outcome.population: Data for 39 participants was available for analysis. 19 participants were exhausted pre-pulmonary rehabilitation. 17 were exhausted following pulmonary rehab.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected from baseline through 6 month follow up.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
